Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Wulfrun1an
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give this hotel 5 stars! Except for one serious failing. Sound proofing between bedrooms! The service at reception, in the breakfast room and the maid service was unbeatable. The hotel was clean and well run. Parking in an underground car park was a welcome bonus. The restaurant next door which was under the same management was also worth visiting. Good food, reasonable pricing and friendly service. Although not near the center, remember the price. Good Value

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Bury St Edmunds, England, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bright Rome”
Reviews.Author: Karolina N
Reviews.Content: + Very nice and clean hotel. Rooms cleaned every day. Friendly and helpful staff. Good breakfast and coffee. - Internet for an additional fee. Very far from the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel but in the outskirts”
Reviews.Author: punitworld
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean, well maintained and staff is very helpful and courteous. Hotel is away from city center and does not have any eating options except an adjacent restaurant. Rooms are medium sized. Can be said to be small. But clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “ANYTHING BUT 4-STAR”
Reviews.Author: GlassofClicquot
Reviews.Content: Compared to the hotels I have stayed in while in Italy I would never grade this is a 4 Star rated hotel, but more of a 1 Star. We stayed in a double room which was adequate in size but the decor was very cheap which matched the furniture. The bathroom was fine although the outer frame of the shower required plenty of cleaning. The lighting in the room was very dim - there's a mini bar in the room but no tea or coffee making facilities. There free wifi internet. There is no in house dining so the hotel staff provide a eating voucher depending on what your stay preference is, we had room / breakfast so a voucher was provided in the morning to eat in the bar/cafe next door called Dadaumpa. The breakfast is basic but fine, we ate pasta for lunch one time which was nice but not outstanding ,the bar is open early to late ,but the downside is when you want to go to bed at night you can hear the music but its not that loud that you cannot get to sleep. Overall it's ok for somewhere to lay your head - if you're not intending to spend a lot of time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Few bedrooms, not a hotel but clean and TOO FAR from ROME”
Reviews.Author: Emad_Ladonni
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel, it's only pair of rooms, the rooms are clean, but small and not a good view. There is no restaurant for breakfast in the hotel, so you have to go a nice bar located next to hotel where you can have your breakfast with a coupon that hotel gives to you. You have to take 2 buses and a metro line to reach to the center of ROME. you need more than an hour to reach the city tourist attraction. of course the public transportation is very good and cheap but you need the time. By the way, it's really good for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “clean, miniature rooms in a far away location”
Reviews.Author: Geneh48
Reviews.Content: Clean, very small room. inexpensive for Rome. But a long way from the action, and i think a long way from any mass transit ito the action. I was there because it was close to the American Hospital, a ten minute walk away, but the neighborhood is pretty sketchy, sidewalks missing in some areas,,, minimal restaurant selection. The restaurant Dadumpa next door was surprisingly good, considering the poor reviews. The rooms were about the smallest I have ever seen,,just glad there wasnt someone with me.

Reviews.Title: “Just in case your favorite Hotel in Rome is fully-booked ...as happened to me.”
Reviews.Author: Aldo051
Reviews.Content: Actually, a sad hotel in front of a very noisy road (Via Prenestina), close to a very noisy wine bar (Da-Da-Umpa, where you will be invited to go for taking your breakfast) especially if your are unfortunate enough (like me) to stay in a front-side room, with very small rooms equipped with even smaller beds. The surrounding is bad, in particular during the night, except if somebody likes to have viados and prostitutes just around the corner, and very far from Rome downtown. Therefore, absolutely to avoid by tourists, families and large and tall people... Positive points: new building, clean, free-of-charge garage.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bright. It might seem like a bargain, but its not.”
Reviews.Author: shareandenjoy
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking this hotel offers good value for money, you could not be more deluded. The simple truth is that by paying an extra £100 per night/room for an hotel much closer to the city centre, not only will your money be very well spent, but it will be much more convenient too. Once you have deducted what you will spend on taxis, the difference is not so much overall. The Hotel itself is clean, tidy and well presented, but the rooms are tiny. Two people can not occupy the same area of the nine by nine foot square space, most of which is taken up by the regular sized double bed anyway. If you are light sleeper stay somewhere else. The walls are paper thin, so the same applies to honeymooners! The person keeping you awake through loud snoring is in fact in the next room, could be above or below too. The windows may as well be boarded up, as there is no view worth seeing from them. Unless you like the very noisy and busy main road to the front, or the industrial estates the side and rear. I can assure you your heart will sink the moment you arrive a the roadside, there is no path either outside the Bright. If a bandit in a taxi tells you there is a suppliment to pay after eight in the evening, he is lying. You may haggle of course, but best to use a White cab with the meter running instead. The bus service from the hotel (508) runs at irregular times and does not go directly to the city, but stops at the train terminus. Now you must now endure the grubbiest stations and trains. Do not use after ten in the evening or alone. You have been warned. The taxis will charge about £25 euro from Rome, you will probably have to give directions, as most look rather blank at the mention of the Bright. It's only eight kilometers outside the city centre, but somewhere most don't ever go. Food at the hotel is provided by be establishment next door. Breakfast is adequate. As with everything here it is grossly overpriced. Generally at least twice you might actually think it is worth. Ironically the best value food is inside Vatican city! All very sensibly priced, even the entry fee £12 is very good value considering all you get to see. Go Wednesday morning and you will see his holiness 'live' addressing the masses in the square. Now is a good time to get in line. Ignore everyone selling tours at so called special rates and VIP entry etc. They are lying. It's only ten euros for an audio guide once inside.
